equipment->Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]

You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

consumable->Bloodseeker Beak.name: Bloodseeker Beak
consumable->Bloodseeker Beak.description:
This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood.

Activate F Envision

Trigger You hit an off-guard creature with the affixed weapon

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
action->Deny Advantage.description: The poisoner isn't off-guard to creatures of 11th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The poisoner is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see

Effect The poisoner gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Impromptu Toxin.name: Impromptu Toxin
action->Impromptu Toxin.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

Effect The poisoner dribbles a few experimental chemicals over a melee weapon. Until the start of their next turn, Strikes with the weapon deal an additional @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage, and targets hit by Strikes with the weapon must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|traits:damaging-effect] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (the poisoner's choice) for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The poisoner deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
action->Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures the poisoner hits with a critical hit are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against their attacks until the end of their next turn.

action->Waves of Sorrow.name: Waves of Sorrow
action->Waves of Sorrow.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description: The obrousian can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This increases their Speed to 25 feet. It doesn't change their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

action->Drowning Grasp.name: Drowning Grasp
action->Drowning Grasp.description: When a creature is grabbed by the obrousian, its lungs magically fill with water. A creature that can't breathe water is suffocating while it is grabbed.

condition->Slowed.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Corpse Wallow.name: Corpse Wallow
action->Corpse Wallow.description: The ofalth zombie gains fast healing 2 as long as it is in the Catacombs or another area with a high concentration of dead.

action->Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
action->Rotting Aura.description:
10 feet. The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour. Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Ofalth Zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[2d6[untyped]] damage as its wounds fester.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the Ofalth Zombie also take this damage immediately.

Note: This ability lists a DC 24 in the source, but the glossary ability lacks a save to make.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: The ofalth zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Bury in Offal.name: Bury in Offal
action->Bury in Offal.description:
The ofalth zombie makes a fling offal Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of any foes within the area of a @Template[cone|distance:15] emanating from the ofalth zombie. This counts as two attacks for the ofalth zombie's multiple attack penalty.

The ofalth zombie can't use Bury in Offal again until it moves at least 10 feet to a different space.

action->Wretched Weeps.name: Wretched Weeps
action->Wretched Weeps.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d8[bleed]] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[bleed]] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPcM4Wt6KmWE2kGL]

Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Whisper of the First Lie.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.sKyJDfHdKacfbNOG]

This delicate necklace contains bottled whispers distilled from a source on the Astral Plane rumored to be connected to the first lie ever told.

While wearing the necklace, you gain a +3 item bonus to Deception checks, and you can attempt to counteract effects that would force you to tell the truth or determine whether you are lying.

Success on this counteract attempt lets you ignore the effect, rather than removing the effect entirely. The counteract rank is 9, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+35]].

Activate 3 Interact, envision, command

Effect You unstopper the vial and release the lie, creating the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6s0UW4bujggma9TC]{Fabricated Truth} (DC 47). The vial is emptied and can never be activated again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of fabricated truth.

consumable->Elixir of Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UHrLqWCnFEUspSQj]

Activate A Interact

The elixir of rejuvenation restores a creature to full health and eradicates toxins affecting it. When you drink this elixir, you're restored to your maximum Hit Points, and all afflictions of 20th level or lower affecting you are removed.

You can instead administer this elixir to a creature that has been dead for a week or less. When you do, that creature is instantly brought back to life with 1 Hit Point and no spell slots, Focus Points, or other daily resources.

Craft Requirements philosopher's stone, true elixir of life

consumable->Tears of Death.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gDGPvobJV1QGYBPy]

Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:46]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 10 minutes

Stage 1 @Damage[18d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[25d6[poison]] damage and paralyzed (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Damage[30d6[poison]] damage and paralyzed (1 minute)

0.text: A creature hit by the Cane of the Maelstrom is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

action->Hidden Paragon.name: Hidden Paragon
action->Hidden Paragon.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger Olansa successfully uses Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and become hidden from all of her current foes, or she uses Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} and become undetected to all her current foes

Effect Olansa becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} for 1 minute, even if she uses a hostile action. Not even @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen}, or similar effects can reveal her, though creatures can still use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to locate her.

action->Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
action->Opportune Backstab.description:

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.description:
An overdrive imentesh can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the overdrive imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The overdrive imentesh's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->Protean Anatomy 19.name: Protean Anatomy 19
action->Protean Anatomy 19.description:
A overdrive imentesh's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly.

Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The overdrive imentesh is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the overdrive imentesh automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

action->Warpwave Strike.name: Warpwave Strike

Pelmo.name: Pelmo
Pelmo.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.yd3kEK21YknZLlcT]

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

action->Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
action->Easy to Call.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

action->Crowded Mob.name: Crowded Mob
action->Crowded Mob.description: The penqual is a swarm of Medium figures that can squeeze supernaturally close to other creatures. Though its component creatures are larger than those of a typical swarm, a penqual can nevertheless share the spaces of other creatures.

action->Crush of Hundreds.name: Crush of Hundreds
action->Crush of Hundreds.description:
A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by the sahkil's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} feels the press of a suffocating crowd.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and takes a –10-foot penalty to all Speeds for as long as it is frightened.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.R8clbf7gtIlU3fIj]{Effect: Crush of Hundreds}

action->Frantic Grasp.name: Frantic Grasp
action->Frantic Grasp.description: Each enemy in the penqual's space takes @Damage[4d12[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save).

action->Mob Rush.name: Mob Rush
action->Mob Rush.description: The penqual Strides twice, ignoring difficult terrain, and then uses Frantic Grasp. If it moves at least 20 feet away from its starting position, the DC of Frantic Grasp increases by 2.

action->Skip Between.name: Skip Between
action->Skip Between.description: The sahkil can move itself between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt}, except that this ability has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed

action->Combustible.name: Combustible
action->Combustible.description: The first time each round that a pickled punk takes fire damage, its fumes combust, dealing @Damage[5[fire]] damage to all other creatures within the area of its Suffocating Fumes aura.

action->Suffocating Fumes.name: Suffocating Fumes
action->Suffocating Fumes.description:
5 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save, or @Check[fortitude|dc:17] if the pickled punk is attached to the creature.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

action->Attach.name: Attach
action->Attach.description:
When a pickled punk hits a target larger than itself, it uses bizarre excretions to adhere to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the pickled punk is not off-guard, and it moves with that creature rather than holding it in place.

Each turn while attached, the pickled punk automatically deals the damage from its jaws Strike to the creature to which it's attached. It also wriggles about, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as it's not also grabbed or restrained.

Plunger Chute.name: Plunger Chute
Plunger Chute.description: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a hidden chute, and a moving section of wall shoves victims into it.
Plunger Chute.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Jam the Trapdoor Shut|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the trapdoor shut or activate a hidden bypass switch by twisting a fitting on the gas lamp

action->Pitfall and Plunger.name: Pitfall and Plunger
action->Pitfall and Plunger.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect Anyone within 10 feet of the room's northern wall falls 40 feet down the shaft to area E33, taking @Damage[20[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage and landing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the ochre jelly's pit.

The victims can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

The DC to Grab an Edge is 20; the DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls is 22.

consumable->Giant Scorpion Venom.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.QGXNqpP5KvSldoZz]

Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

action->Toxin-Inured.name: Toxin-Inured
action->Toxin-Inured.description: A poison eater can't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition from poisons.

action->Consume Poison.name: Consume Poison
action->Consume Poison.description:
The poison eater uses an Interact action to draw a dose of poison and eats it, gaining strength.

The poison-eater's Strikes deal two weapon dice of damage rather than one. The poison eater is affected by the consumed poison normally and, therefore, usually chooses poisons mitigated by their poison resistance and toxin-inured ability.

At the end of each of their turns, the poison eater attempts a @Check[flat|dc:17|name:Consumed Poison Metabolizes] check; on a success, this ability ends.

0.label: The Poison Eater has Consumed a Poison

action->Poison Frenzy.name: Poison Frenzy
action->Poison Frenzy.description:
Requirements The poison eater isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger the poison eater damages a creature while Consume Poison is in effect

Effect The poison eater flies into a frenzy that lasts for 1 minute. While in a frenzy, the poison eater gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with melee Strikes, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with melee Strikes, gains 20 temporary Hit Points until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The poison eater can't voluntarily end their frenzy. After their frenzy, the poison eater is fatigued.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.u2z1BgpZsxl7Zc2z]{Effect: Poison Frenzy}

Poisoned Dart Statue.name: Poisoned Dart Statue
Poisoned Dart Statue.description: Countless poison darts fire from holes in the statues and walls of this hall.
Poisoned Dart Statue.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
Poisoned Dart Statue.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Poisoned Dart Statue.routine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the hall as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature's turn. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Poisoned Dart Statue.stealth: (expert) or @Check[perception|dc:39|traits:action:seek] (master) to notice the control panel. Anyone specifically searching the name plate of Abresha Tallow-Hands locates the control panel automatically.

action->Dart Volley.name: Dart Volley
action->Dart Volley.description:
Trigger A creature makes noise in the hall, which can be avoided with a successful @Check[stealth|dc:28|name:Avoid Notice|traits:action:sneak,move,secret] check

Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

action->Continuous Barrage.name: Continuous Barrage
action->Continuous Barrage.description:
Trigger A creature within the hallway finishes an action while the trap is active

Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Terinav Root Poison.name: Terinav Root Poison
action->Terinav Root Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 2 5d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and –5-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Stage 3 7d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

armor->+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
armor->+1 Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Religious Symbol (norgorber).name: Religious Symbol (norgorber)
equipment->Religious Symbol (norgorber).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

consumable->Arrows With Shadow Essence.name: Arrows With Shadow Essence
consumable->Arrows With Shadow Essence.description:
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Infused with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Wjkw0lEUOhypYvzo]{Shadow Essence}

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Toxic Mastery.name: Toxic Mastery
action->Toxic Mastery.description: Kalyn can masterfully manipulate vile, poisonous energy and increase its potency. Her melee and ranged Strikes deal an additional 2d6 poison damage, and a target that takes this poison damage has a -1 status penalty to saving throws against Kalyn's divine spells for 1 round. Poisons delivered by Kalyn have the virulent trait.

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue
Prospecti Statue.publicNotes: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

weapon->+1 Longsword (Huge).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]
+1 Longsword (Huge)

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

action->Stone Robes.name: Stone Robes
action->Stone Robes.description:
The Prospecti statue turns suddenly, causing its robes, which flow like fabric despite being as hard as stone, to swing about and damage opponents.

Creatures adjacent to the animated statue take @Damage[(2d6+6)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save; on a critical failure, the creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).

Pulping Golem.name: Pulping Golem
Pulping Golem.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by acid (@Damage[(6d10+4)[untyped]], @Damage[(2d8+4)[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[(2d8+4)[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

action->Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
action->Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The pulping golem spills its cauldron stomach to the floor, dealing @Damage[9d12[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within 10 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Extend Legs.name: Extend Legs
action->Extend Legs.description: The pulping golem extends its legs up to a height of 40 feet, raising its body high into the air. While its legs are extended, its movement speed is halved, and it takes a -2 penalty to its Fortitude save DC against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempts.

action->Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
action->Inexorable March.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.

action->Iron Golem Poison.name: Iron Golem Poison
action->Iron Golem Poison.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:35]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[(2d6+4)[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[(4d6+4)[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[(8d6+4)[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

equipment->Ring of Discretion.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.FABVnBeYtGXshlwm]

This ring magically conceals any armor and sheathed weapons you're wearing by either turning them invisible or creating the illusion of ordinary clothes. The ring doesn't change your appearance beyond concealing weapons and armor. As soon as you wield a weapon, the weapon becomes obvious to onlookers and is no longer affected by the ring until you sheathe the weapon for at least 1 minute. A creature can disbelieve this illusion by Seeking or any time it hits you with an attack.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.e0vSAQfxhHauiAoD]

A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Double Stab.name: Double Stab
action->Double Stab.description:
Requirements Ralso is wielding two piercing weapons

Frequency once per round

Effect Ralso makes two Strikes against a single creature within reach, one Strike per weapon.

These attacks count toward Ralso's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Ralso deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.lR9R5Vld8Eu2Dha5]
Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Fire or Acid)

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A ravenile can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

action->Forced Regeneration.name: Forced Regeneration
action->Forced Regeneration.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently active

The ravenile regains @Damage[20[healing]] HP.

action->Furious Wallop.name: Furious Wallop
action->Furious Wallop.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently deactivated

Effect The ravenile makes a melee Strike.

This counts as two attacks for the ravenile's multiple attack penalty.

If this Strike hits, the ravenile deals an extra die of weapon damage and the target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Rend.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

Claw

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

action->Clockwork Reconstruction.name: Clockwork Reconstruction
action->Clockwork Reconstruction.description: Each time Reginald is reborn in his lair, his machines graft him with a new clockwork modification. He chooses one of his abilities with the clockwork trait. He gains access to this ability but can't use any of his other clockwork abilities. He can't choose the same ability twice in a row. He begins with Ink Blood active.

action->Ink Blood.name: Ink Blood
action->Ink Blood.description:
Reginald's body is filled with toxic ink

Trigger An adjacent creature Strikes Reginald with a melee weapon or unarmed attack and deals damage

Effect The creature is exposed to Reginald's poison ink.

action->Secret of Rebirth.name: Secret of Rebirth
action->Secret of Rebirth.description: If a creature with less than 5 Secret Knowledge points reduces Reginald to 0 HP (or dealt the last damage to him before he dies from using Overdrive Engine), Reginald's body dissipates into a puddle of ink and releases a black wave of psychic energy. Each creature within 30 feet is bathed in a torrent of forbidden secrets and gains 1 Secret Knowledge point. Reginald's body reforms [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} later in his sanctum at full health at a location of his choosing (typically the Pool of Secrets, area L11). This ability activates automatically with no action necessary on Vancaskerkin's behalf.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: Reginald's lungs are equipped with ink canisters, allowing him to spew a @Template[line|distance:60] of ink that deals @Damage[9d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic|options:area-effect] save; on a failure, the creature is also subjected to Reginald's poison ink).

action->Overdrive Engine.name: Overdrive Engine
action->Overdrive Engine.description:
Reginald is equipped with clockwork organs to power his body

Requirements Reginald has 175 Hit Points or fewer

Effect Reginald gains 200 temporary Hit Points, a +15-foot status bonus to Speed, and a +2 status bonus to melee attack rolls. His body begins to overheat, spewing steam that deals @Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage at the beginning of his turn to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). After 2 rounds, Reginald explodes, dealing @Damage[19d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). Reginald dies. For the purposes of his Secret of Rebirth ability, the last creature to damage Reginald counts as killing him.

action->Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
action->Poison Ink.description:
Reginald is immune to the toxic ink that flows through his veins

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round).

action->Quill Cannon.name: Quill Cannon
action->Quill Cannon.description: Reginald is equipped with a cannon and hundreds of steel quills. He makes two steel quill attacks against every creature in a @Template[cone|distance:60], ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all attacks are made. He can't use Quill Cannon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Quill Cannon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Reflective Plating.name: Reflective Plating
action->Reflective Plating.description: Reginald engages his defensive plating, which casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning} on him (counteract modifier +32).

action->Slither.name: Slither
action->Slither.description: With his body composed of ink and gears, Reginald can move through tight spaces as if he were a Tiny creature, treating them as difficult terrain.

action->Plunder Life.name: Plunder Life
action->Plunder Life.description:
60 feet. When a healing effect restores Hit Points to a non-fiend creature in the aura, the amount of Hit Points restored is halved. The rhevanna gains temporary Hit Points equal to the amount of Hit Points restored.

The rhevanna loses any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

action->Detaining Strike.name: Detaining Strike
action->Detaining Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The rhevanna hits a creature with a weapon Strike

Effect The rhevanna casts an innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ksLCg62cLOojw3gN]{Planar Tether} spell on the creature.

action->Lifedrinker.name: Lifedrinker
action->Lifedrinker.description:
Trigger The rhevanna kills a living creature of at least 16th level

Effect The rhevanna drinks the triggering creature's life force and regains @Damage[40[healing]] Hit Points. If the triggering creature is a celestial, the rhevanna instead regains @Damage[80[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Malefic Binding.name: Malefic Binding
action->Malefic Binding.description:
The rhevanna can target celestials with their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} ability, and a gem containing a celestial bound by a rhevanna has Hardness 40.

If the rhevanna destroys a gem in which they placed a celestial, the celestial is destroyed forever.

Rigged Cubby.name: Rigged Cubby
Rigged Cubby.description: A hidden string connected to precariously stacked bricks causes the cubby to collapse in on itself when the string is pulled.
Rigged Cubby.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Cut String|traits:action:disable-a-device] to cut the string without setting off the trap

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sickle in the cubby

Effect The heavy bricks above the cubby collapse, leaving the sickle unscathed but dealing @Damage[(4d6+10)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save) to the triggering creature.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking War Razor.name: +2 Greater Striking War Razor
weapon->+2 Greater Striking War Razor.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Necklace of Fireballs VI.name: Necklace of Fireballs VI
equipment->Necklace of Fireballs VI.description:
This string of beads appears to be a hemp string with lustrous red beads of various sizes hanging from it. When activated, it briefly appears in its true form: a golden chain with golden spheres attached by fine threads.

This necklace has one @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage, three @Damage[14d6[fire]] damage and four @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage beads with a Reflex save DC of 36. When all the beads are gone, the necklace becomes a non-magical hemp string.

Activate A Interact

Effect You detach a sphere from the necklace, causing it to glow with orange light. After you activate a sphere, if you or anyone else hurls it (an Interact action with the ranged trait), it detonates as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} where it lands. Your toss can place the center of the fireball anywhere within 70 feet, though at the GM's discretion you might need to make an attack roll if the throw is unusually challenging. If no one hurls the sphere by the start of your next turn, it turns into a non-magical red bead.

action->Bloody Mayhem.name: Bloody Mayhem
action->Bloody Mayhem.description: Sad Liza Strides three times. Once per Stride, she can attempt a war razor Strike against a creature in her reach at any point during the Stride; she must make each Strike against a different creature, but she doesn't apply her multiple attack penalty until after making all her Strikes. If any of the Strikes are a critical failure, Bloody Mayhem immediately ends.

action->Close Cutter.name: Close Cutter
action->Close Cutter.description: Whenever Sad Liza deals slashing damage, the target takes an additional 2d10 persistent bleed damage.

action->Fan of Daggers.name: Fan of Daggers
action->Fan of Daggers.description: Sad Liza makes three ranged dagger Strikes, each against a separate target; she ignores the multiple attack penalty until after making all three Strikes. On a critical hit, the target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

action->Knife Thrower.name: Knife Thrower
action->Knife Thrower.description: Sad Liza's ranged dagger Strikes have a range increment of 20 feet instead of 10 feet.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Sad Liza deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (3r.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.3Lexs7KnhbV0HgFh]

This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} at 3rd rank.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate rank.

action->Drain Wand.name: Drain Wand
action->Drain Wand.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Scathka hasn't acted yet on their turn

Effect On their turn, Scathka casts one spell they've prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Scathka must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

action->Throw Shadow Blade.name: Throw Shadow Blade
action->Throw Shadow Blade.description:
Requirement Scathka is wielding a dagger

Effect Scathka draws a shadowy glyph on the dagger's blade and flings it at a nearby foe. Scathka makes a ranged Strike with the dagger with the range increment to 30 feet.

If the Strike hits, it deals @Damage[8d6[cold]] damage (double damage on a critical success) and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn (or [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

The dagger loses its shadowy magic as soon as the attack is resolved.

Secret-Keeper.name: Secret-Keeper
Secret-Keeper.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

spell->Undetectable Alignment.name: Undetectable Alignment
spell->Undetectable Alignment.description: You shroud a creature in wards that hide its alignment. The target appears to be neutral to all effects that would detect its alignment.

spell->Chill Touch.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]
Chill Touch

weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.name: +2 Striking Dagger
weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

shield->Sturdy Shield (Moderate).name: Sturdy Shield (Moderate)
shield->Sturdy Shield (Moderate).description:
With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Cape of the Mountebank.name: Cape of the Mountebank
equipment->Cape of the Mountebank.description:
This bright red-and-gold cape is often interlaced with glittery threads and serves as a distraction. While wearing the cape, you gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks.

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}. The space you leave and the one you appear in are filled with puffs of smoke that make anyone within concealed until they leave the smoke or the end of your next turn, at which point the smoke dissipates. Strong winds immediately disperse the smoke.

equipment->Religious Symbol of Norgorber.name: Religious Symbol of Norgorber
equipment->Religious Symbol of Norgorber.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Menta.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

action->Designate Apostate.name: Designate Apostate
action->Designate Apostate.description: Velberi designates one creature she can see within 30 feet as an apostate to the church of Norgorber, regardless of the creature's actual religious leanings. She can have up to four apostates designated at a time; any additional apostate removes another apostate of her choice. Velberi treats all Perception checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} against an apostate as one degree of success better, and her Strikes deal an additional 2d8 mental damage to apostates.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Divert Strike.name: Divert Strike
action->Divert Strike.description:
Trigger A shatterling takes non-bludgeoning damage and there's an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the shatterling

Effect The nearest mirror to the shatterling at least 1 foot wide breaks, and the damage to the shatterling is reduced to 0.

action->Extra Reaction.name: Extra Reaction
action->Extra Reaction.description: A shatterling gains an additional reaction each turn, but can use this extra reaction only for Divert Strike.

action->Mirror Senses.name: Mirror Senses
action->Mirror Senses.description: A shatterling can see and hear through any unbroken mirror within 100 feet.

action->Blood-Fueled Titter.name: Blood-Fueled Titter
action->Blood-Fueled Titter.description: If the shatterling attempts an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] a target within 30 feet of a creature with persistent bleed damage, the shatterling has +4 circumstance bonus to the Intimidation check. In addition, the shatterling takes no penalty to the check for not speaking a language the target can hear, and the target isn't temporarily immune to the shatterling's attempts to Demoralize it unless the shatterling critically fails its Intimidation check.

action->Mirror Jump.name: Mirror Jump
action->Mirror Jump.description: During this Stride, the shatterling can move into any unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide and out of another unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the first mirror, treating the mirrors as connected. The shatterling can move through any number of pairs of foot-wide mirrors during its mirror jump, requiring each pair to be within 100 feet of each other while doing so.

action->Vanish in Reflections.name: Vanish in Reflections
action->Vanish in Reflections.description: The shatterling doesn't appear in reflective surfaces if it doesn't want to. When it's within 100 feet of an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide, a shatterling can Hide and Sneak even without cover or without being concealed.

action->Wipe Away Cracks.name: Wipe Away Cracks
action->Wipe Away Cracks.description: The shatterling touches a broken mirror, instantly repairing it.

weapon->+1 Striking Scimitar.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.grmaV4GdoGD7sKbn]
+1 Striking Scimitar

shield->Wooden Shield.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ezVp13Uw8cWW08Da]

Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 12 6

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Moderate).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y8115p3cmQJBqk5d]

Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A Shikwashim mercenary can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

action->Coordinated Distraction.name: Coordinated Distraction
action->Coordinated Distraction.description:
With a sharp whistle or wave of their hand, the mercenary distracts an opponent so one of the mercenary's allies can land a clean blow.

The mercenary chooses a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet of the mercenary. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the first Strike the mercenary's ally makes on its next turn; if the ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost.

Depending on how the mercenary distracts their foe, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

action->Human Hunter.name: Human Hunter
action->Human Hunter.description: A Shikwashim mercenary's multiple attack penalty for attacks against humans is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on their second attack per turn or -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on their third or subsequent attack per turn.

action->Powerful Swipe.name: Powerful Swipe
action->Powerful Swipe.description:
The Shikwashim mercenary makes a melee Strike. If it hits, it deals an extra die of damage.

This counts as two attacks for the mercenary's multiple attack penalty.

action->Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
action->Terrain Advantage.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a Swim speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to a Shikwashim mercenary.

action->Compression.name: Compression
action->Compression.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(1d4+4)[bludgeoning]] damage, @Check[fortitude|dc:16|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Control Body.name: Control Body
action->Control Body.description:
Requirements The shredskin is adjacent to a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities.

Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally.

The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 hit points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points.

Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC.

action->Enshroud.name: Enshroud
action->Enshroud.description:
Requirements The shredskin is grabbing a creature

Effect The shredskin attempts to pin the creature and wrap itself around the creature like a shirt. The shredskin rolls an @Check[athletics|against:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and the shredskin can take control of the creature as if using Control Body.

At the start of its turn, the shredskin can automatically Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action.

An enshrouded creature can attempt a [[/act escape dc=16]] check to break free ([[/act escape dc=18]] if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).

treasure->Victor's Medallion from the Ch.name: Victor's Medallion from the Challenge of Sky and Heaven

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description:
Shristi makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. He applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

As it has the flourish trait, Shristi can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.

action->Heaven's Thunder.name: Heaven's Thunder
action->Heaven's Thunder.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect With a loud shout, Shristi unleashes his ki as a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs his body. Until the end of his next turn, Shristi's unarmed Strikes and Strikes with weapons that have the monk trait deal an additional 3 electricity damage and 3 sonic damage.

action->Sky and Heaven Stance.name: Sky and Heaven Stance
action->Sky and Heaven Stance.description:
Shristi enters a combat stance perfected by past champions of the Challenge of Sky and Heaven. While in this stance, the only Strikes Shristi can make are skyward slash unarmed attacks. These deal 1d10 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, unarmed, and versatile P traits.

While in Sky and Heaven Stance, Shristi gains resistance 2 to electricity and sonic damage.

spell->Meld into Stone (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]
Meld into Stone (At Will)

spell->Mage Hand.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mage Hand

action->Exorcism.name: Exorcism
action->Exorcism.description:
Mental damage ignores a siege shard's hardness.

Additionally, proving the siege shard's generative conflict is over with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Ma93dpT4K7JbP9gu]{Prove Peace} activity reverts the creature to ordinary stone.

action->Surreptitious Siege.name: Surreptitious Siege
action->Surreptitious Siege.description: While a siege shard is embedded within a structure while using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, the structure and all objects within it take twice as long to repair.

action->Overwhelming Anguish.name: Overwhelming Anguish
action->Overwhelming Anguish.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The siege shard emits a disorienting psychic blast. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:15] take @Damage[4d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
When a siege shard is destroyed within 100 feet of a structure, it reforms after [[/br 2d4 #days]] days within the nearest structure, fully healed.

A siege shard within a structure can permanently destroyed by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.QW2gYIKce3W31xXf]{Prove Peace} activity.

action->Distracting Shadows.name: Distracting Shadows
action->Distracting Shadows.description: Skebs can use creatures that are at least one size larger than themself as cover for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Skebs deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->+1 Shortsword.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.7tKkkF8eZ4iCLJtp]
+1 Shortsword

weapon->War Razor.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nOFcCidD5AwVZWTv]

A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Silver) of.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.upzjwQ96cZG0Xlmx]
Religious Symbol (Silver) of Norgorber
equipment->Religious Symbol (Silver) of.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.upzjwQ96cZG0Xlmx]

This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

equipment->Skinsaw Mask.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.sgH9U2fKqWCedKNO]

A patchwork of humanoid flesh makes up this grotesque mask stitched together with black silk or wire. It is distinctive for its bulbous orange eye- crafted from a magical glass bauble-and wide row of teeth.

When worn, the mask amplifies your ability to sense fear in other creatures.

You automatically know the value of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition of any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} creature, and you gain a +1 item bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} frightened creatures. Whenever you deal precision damage to a frightened creature, you deal 1 additional precision damage.

If you are not evil, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} while wearing the Skinsaw mask.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

When attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature, the Skinsaw murderer deals 1d6 additional precision damage.

action->Twin Takedown.name: Twin Takedown
action->Twin Takedown.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.

Effect You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against a creature, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.7tKkkF8eZ4iCLJtp]
+1 Striking Shortsword

weapon->War Razor.description:
